comments:
the c-code:
   int func_def();
   int func_def(int a);
   int func_proto();

For the name 'func_proto' I get a bining of type IFunction. Calling
IFunction.isStatic() upon it results in an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.c.CFunction.updateParameterBindings
(CFunction.java:264)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.c.CFunction.addDeclarator
(CFunction.java:62)

n.visit(CPPVisitor.java:1006)

(CASTName.java:76)

ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is fixed.  Caused indirectly by the 2 func_def
functions not having the same parameter lists.  This brings up the issue of
needing to check the compatibility of function redeclarations and raise problems
as appropriate.  See bug 93001
